result.execSummary:
The defendant Hmong Moua was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hmong Moua is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hmong Moua was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

DNA sample; pay the surcharge.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hmong Moua

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Hmong Moua in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Hmong Moua in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 8 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Hmong Moua in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Defense counsel miscalendared this hearing and is not available.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Hmong Moua in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant wishes to change his plea.
As to count 1:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
As to count 2:
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 dismissed.
Jury trial date is vacated.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant would like to enter a plea.  Court is in trial.  Branch 36 agreed to hear the matter.  rmm
Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-16-2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-07-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court will not modify No Contact Order at this time.

Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set, including the No Contact Order.

Defendant Hmong Moua in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.  For reasons stated on the record, Court orders August 19 trial vacated and case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Hmong Moua in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered the children removed from the no contact order.

Defendant Hmong Moua in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for pretrial conference.  Defendant does not qualify for a public defender and informed the Court he will be hiring counsel.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-19-15

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ger L. and children.

Defendant Hmong Moua in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/21/15 @ 1:30pm
